H0.text: Energy is the condition that must be identical for atomic orbitals to exhibit the greatest interaction.

H1.text: Temperature is the property that must be the same for the interaction between atomic orbitals to be greatest.

H2.text: Mass is the property that must be the same for atomic orbitals to interact most strongly.

H3.text: Fuel is the same property that must be shared by atomic orbitals for their interaction to be greatest.

A4.text: Atomic orbitals must be at similar energy levels to combine as molecular orbitals.

A5.text: Because if the energy difference is great, when the molecular orbitals form, the change in energy becomes small.
